adjective.description: Having feathered (or furry) feet. Chiefly in the names of birds and domestic varieties of them, as "rough-footed cock", "rough-footed pigeon", etc.
Scottish. Wearing shoes of undressed hide. Now historical.

origin: Late 15th century; earliest use found in Trevisa's Bartholomeus De Proprietatibus Rerum. From rough + footed.
